title: Traditional monogram structure?
content:
For a traditional 3 initial monogram, is the following a proper structure?

Left letter - first name initial  
Right letter - middle name initial  
Central letter - last name initial, usually larger than the left or right

Does that sounds about right?
author: npgraphicdesign

comments.content: I think this might be helpful: [http://spiritfilleddesigns.com/monogram-structure/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140714065157/http:/spiritfilleddesigns.com/monogram-structure/)

Thanks George. I've seen that link before, but I've also come across examples where a monogram for a male was as I described in my post. In the link above, that structure is used for a woman's monogram. You see my conundrum?
I didn't read everything at the link I provided, but I agree that your description is most likely the logical one so would be most preferred.
Thanks George. I hope that after all my research I am right, or my whole identity redesign goes down the drain. ;)
